itemMetadata.narrative: A simple iron blade with a wooden handle. Every warrior's first step on the path to mastery. The weight feels right in your hand - not perfect, but yours.

metadata.narrative: The foundational smithing technique - blade, tang, handle. Simple in concept, demanding in execution. Every smith remembers their first sword.

itemMetadata.narrative: Basic copper pickaxe with a wooden handle. Your first step into the mining profession - crude but functional.

metadata.narrative: Your first pickaxe. The gateway to greater resources and deeper discoveries.

itemMetadata.narrative: Simple copper axe with oak handle. Every woodcutter's first companion on the journey to mastery.

metadata.narrative: Basic axe for woodcutting. Simple but essential for any aspiring adventurer.

itemMetadata.narrative: Simple copper-tipped spear with ash wood shaft. The extra reach keeps danger at arm's length. Perfect for those who prefer distance over direct confrontation.

metadata.narrative: Simple spear with copper tip. Keep your enemies at a distance.

itemMetadata.narrative: Basic leather protection stitched from wolf pelts and bound with slime gel. Better than nothing, lighter than metal, and it might just save your life.

metadata.narrative: Basic leather protection. Better than nothing, lighter than metal.

itemMetadata.narrative: Reinforced leather boots with iron caps. Protects your feet without slowing you down. Essential for anyone who values both mobility and survival.

metadata.narrative: Reinforced leather boots with iron caps. Protects your feet without slowing you down.

itemMetadata.narrative: Reliable iron pickaxe. Durable enough to tackle tougher deposits and efficient for standard mining work.

metadata.narrative: Upgraded pickaxe that can tackle tougher deposits. Iron reliability meets practical design.

itemMetadata.narrative: Sturdy iron axe that bites deep into wood. The standard tool for serious forestry work.

metadata.narrative: Solid iron axe for serious forestry work. Bites deep and true.

itemMetadata.narrative: Balanced steel longsword that flows like water and strikes like thunder. The blade sings when it cuts through air, a testament to its quality.

metadata.narrative: Balanced steel longsword. The blade flows like water, strikes like thunder.

itemMetadata.narrative: Iron plates protecting vital organs with beetle carapace reinforcement. Heavy but reliable. When arrows fly and blades swing, you'll appreciate every ounce of protection.

metadata.narrative: Iron plates protect vital organs. Heavy but reliable.

itemMetadata.narrative: Steel helm with full face protection and wolf pelt padding. Your head stays attached, which is nice. The padding reduces the ringing when you take a hit.

metadata.narrative: Steel helm with full face protection. Your head stays attached, which is nice.

itemMetadata.narrative: Steel pickaxe with perfect balance. Bites into hard rock with confidence.

metadata.narrative: Steel pickaxe with perfect balance. Makes hard rock feel like clay.

itemMetadata.narrative: Well-balanced steel axe with a razor edge. Fells even ancient trees with steady, powerful strikes.

metadata.narrative: Razor-edged steel axe. Ancient trees fall before it.

itemMetadata.narrative: Mithril dagger that seems to shimmer out of existence. Wickedly sharp and impossibly light, it strikes faster than the eye can follow. The blade whispers through air and flesh alike.

metadata.narrative: Mithril dagger that seems to shimmer out of existence. Wickedly sharp, impossibly light.

itemMetadata.narrative: Legendary mithril pickaxe that sings through stone. Impossibly light yet incredibly effective.

metadata.narrative: Legendary mithril pickaxe that sings through stone. Impossibly light yet incredibly effective.

itemMetadata.narrative: Ethereal mithril axe that seems to phase through wood fibers. Cuts with minimal resistance.

metadata.narrative: Ethereal mithril axe that phases through wood fibers. Cuts with minimal resistance.

itemMetadata.narrative: Simple copper band holding a fire crystal. Radiates gentle warmth against your skin. The crystal pulses with contained flames, never dimming, never burning.

metadata.narrative: Simple copper band with fire crystal. Radiates gentle warmth.

itemMetadata.narrative: Iron amulet cradling water crystals. Feels cool against your skin, like a gentle stream running across your chest. The crystals shimmer with captured tides.

metadata.narrative: Iron amulet holding a water crystal. Feels cool against your skin.

itemMetadata.narrative: Steel bracelet woven with lightning shards and spectral thread. Crackles with stored static electricity. Touch it and feel the power humming beneath the surface.

metadata.narrative: Steel bracelet with lightning shard. Crackles with stored static.

itemMetadata.narrative: Simple pine shortbow strung with treated slime gel. Not powerful, but reliable and easy to maintain. Perfect for learning the basics of archery.

metadata.narrative: Simple pine bow strung with treated sinew. Not powerful, but reliable.

itemMetadata.narrative: Steel battleaxe with brutal cleaving power. Grip it with both hands and watch enemies fall like timber. Equally deadly in one hand for those strong enough to wield it.

metadata.narrative: Forging a steel battleaxe requires balance - too heavy and it's unwieldy, too light and it lacks impact. This versatile weapon can devastate with two hands or still threaten with one.

itemMetadata.narrative: Heavy iron warhammer that crushes armor and bone alike. The weight demands both hands, but the devastation it delivers makes that trade worthwhile. Favored by those who prefer decisive, crushing blows.

metadata.narrative: Crafting a warhammer is about managing weight distribution. The crushing head must be perfectly balanced on the shaft, or it becomes a liability rather than a weapon.

itemMetadata.narrative: Simple copper dagger, light and quick. Not much reach, but what it lacks in power it makes up for in speed. Perfect for those who value precision over brute force.

metadata.narrative: A dagger is deceptively simple - just a blade and a grip. But the balance must be perfect for quick, precise strikes.

itemMetadata.narrative: Composite longbow of ash wood and sinew, strung with silk-spider thread. The draw is heavy, demanding both hands and steady arms, but arrows fly true and far. Distance is your advantage.

metadata.narrative: Crafting a composite bow requires laminating different materials - wood for flexibility, sinew for power, silk for the string. Patience yields deadly accuracy.

itemMetadata.narrative: Ironwood staff capped with a pulsing fire crystal. The wood never burns, the crystal never dims. Channel elemental forces through this focus, or wield it as a quarterstaff when enemies close distance.

metadata.narrative: Binding a fire crystal to ironwood creates a conduit for elemental power. The wood never burns, the crystal never dims - a perfect symbiosis.

itemMetadata.narrative: Round iron shield with oak backing. Not just for blocking - bash enemies with the rim or use it to create openings. Defense and offense in one hand.

metadata.narrative: A simple round shield - iron face with oak backing. Protects and strikes in equal measure.

itemMetadata.narrative: Steel plate leggings with articulated joints. Heavy but protective, they guard your legs without restricting movement. Every smith's second major armor piece after the chestplate.

metadata.narrative: Steel plate leggings with articulated joints. Protecting your legs without sacrificing mobility is the mark of quality armor.

itemMetadata.narrative: Leather gloves reinforced with iron studs across the knuckles. Light enough for dexterity, strong enough to turn a blade. Your hands are tools - protect them.

metadata.narrative: Reinforced leather gloves with iron studs across the knuckles. Your hands are your tools - protect them properly.

itemMetadata.narrative: Flexible bamboo rod with silk line and bronze hook. Patient hands pull dinner from rivers and lakes. Not much use in a fight, but starvation kills just as surely as swords.

metadata.narrative: Flexible bamboo rod with silk line and bronze hook. Patience and the right tool can pull dinner from any water.

itemMetadata.narrative: Curved steel blade designed for harvesting herbs, grains, and fibrous plants. The razor edge cuts clean without bruising delicate materials. Adequate for self-defense in a pinch.

metadata.narrative: Curved steel blade perfect for harvesting delicate plants. Clean cuts preserve quality and maximize yield.
